newsitem.title: USA: Tech strength pushed Nasdaq to fourth record high.
newsitem.headline: Tech strength pushed Nasdaq to fourth record high.

text.p: Nasdaq shares rallied to their fourth consecutive record high on Tuesday, powered by continued strength in large capitalization technology stocks.

The Nasdaq composite index gained 14.33 points or 0.97 percent to close unofficially at 1485.07, the 21st record close of the year. Gaining issues beat decliners 2360 to 1982 on total volume of 635 million shares.
"The big name techs are just pushing the Nasdaq higher. The large techs are acting like Blue Chips, and the Blue Chips helped push the Dow up 104 points today," one trader said.
Dell Computer Corp gained 2-5/8 to a new 52-week high of 127-3/4. Intel Corp, the most active Nasdaq issues, added 2-1/4 to 149-5/8 and Microsoft Corp added 1-3/4 to 131-1/4.
The Russell 2000 index, a key barometer of small capitalization stocks, added 2.03 points or 0.51 percent to a new record of 398.29.

PairGain Technologies Inc, which is expected to report its second quarter earnings on Wednesday, added 2 to 17-7/8. Analysts said PairGain's rival, Adtran Inc, showed growth in HDSL shipments, which could signal similar strength at PairGain, the dominant player in HDSL technology.
